exercises.setup_notes: Sit down at a lat pull-down machine and adjust the knee pad to fit snugly against your thighs.
exercises.execution_notes: Grip the bar with a wide grip, pull the bar down to your upper chest while keeping your back straight, and then slowly return to the starting position.
exercises.tier_reasons: Offers a big stretch on your lats, provides smooth even tension throughout the range of motion, feels great, and allows for easy overload by increasing the pin weight.
exercises.targeted_muscle_parts: Targets both the lats and mid traps due to the wide grip and pulling motion.
exercises.selection_reason: The Wide Grip Lat Pull Down is an excellent choice for overall back definition, targeting both the lats and mid traps. It provides a big stretch and smooth tension, which is beneficial for beginners aiming for back development. The exercise is also easy to overload, aligning with the user's goal of overall back definition.

exercises.setup_notes: Use a preacher bench to angle your upper arm.
exercises.execution_notes: Ensure full range of motion by going all the way down and maintaining high tension in the stretched position.
exercises.tier_reasons: High tension in stretched position, locks elbows to prevent cheating, significant distal biceps growth.
exercises.targeted_muscle_parts: Distal biceps, due to high tension in stretched position.
exercises.scientific_insights: Study shows preacher curls cause more distal biceps growth compared to incline curls.
exercises.selection_reason: The Preacher Curl is ideal for beginners aiming for bigger biceps. It provides high tension in the stretched position, which is crucial for muscle growth, and locks the elbows to prevent cheating. This exercise is effective for distal biceps growth, aligning with the user's goal of bigger biceps.

warmup_exercises.execution_notes: Extend your arms out to the sides and make small circles, gradually increasing the size.

warmup_exercises.setup_notes: Get on all fours with hands under shoulders and knees under hips.
warmup_exercises.execution_notes: Alternate between arching your back (cat) and dropping your belly (cow).
Swing your arms out to the sides and then cross them in front of your chest.
